buy/sell flows with optional EIP-2612 permit integration for one-click trades.      All external functions are nonReentrant to prevent cross-function attacks.","errors":{"AccessControlBadConfirmation()":[{"details":"The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}],"ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()":[{"details":"Unauthorized reentrant call."}],"SafeERC20FailedOperation(address)":[{"details":"An operation with an ERC-20 token failed."}]},"events":{"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"buyWithPermit(uint256,uint8,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint8,bytes32,bytes32)":{"params":{"marketId":"The ID of the market to trade in.","maxCost":"Maximum collateral the user is willing to spend (slippage protection).","outcome":"The outcome index to buy.","permitDeadline":"EIP-2612 permit deadline (0 to skip permit).","permitR":"EIP-2612 signature r.","permitS":"EIP-2612 signature s.","permitV":"EIP-2612 signature v.","shareDelta":"The number of shares to purchase (in UD60x18 fixed-point)."},"returns":{"totalCost":"The actual cost paid by the user."}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"sellAndTransfer(uint256,uint8,uint256,uint256,address)":{"params":{"marketId":"The ID of the market to trade in.","minPayout":"Minimum collateral the user expects to receive (slippage protection).","outcome":"The outcome index to sell.","recipient":"Address to receive the payout (use msg.sender to receive directly).","shareDelta":"The number of shares to sell (in UD60x18 fixed-point)."},"returns":{"netPayout":"The actual payout sent to the recipient."}}},"title":"Router","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"PAUSER_ROLE()":{"notice":"Role for addresses allowed to pause the router in emergencies."},"buyWithPermit(uint256,uint8,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint8,bytes32,bytes32)":{"notice":"Buy outcome shares with optional EIP-2612 permit for gasless approval."},"getMarket(uint256)":{"notice":"Get the market address for a given market ID."},"isMarketRegistered(uint256)":{"notice":"Check if a market is registered with the router."},"markets(uint256)":{"notice":"Mapping from market ID to the deployed LMSRMarket contract address."},"onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,uint256[],uint256[],bytes)":{"notice":"Handle receipt of multiple ERC1155 tokens."},"onERC1155Received(address,address,uint256,uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Handle receipt of a single ERC1155 token."},"outcomeToken()":{"notice":"Shared outcome token contract for minting/burning shares across markets."},"paused()":{"notice":"Indicates whether the router is paused, blocking all trades."},"registerMarket(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Register a market so the router can interact with it."},"sellAndTransfer(uint256,uint8,uint256,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Sell outcome shares and transfer proceeds to a specified recipient."},"setPaused(bool)":{"notice":"Pause or unpause the router to block trades in emergencies."},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"notice":"ERC165 interface support."}},"notice":"Gasless UX helper for batched trading operations. Single call target for Biconomy params.marketId: The ID of the market to trade in.
params.maxCost: Maximum collateral the user is willing to spend (slippage protection).
params.permitDeadline: EIP-2612 permit deadline (0 to skip permit).
params.shareDelta: The number of shares to purchase (in UD60x18 fixed-point).

returns.totalCost: The actual cost paid by the user.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.marketId: The ID of the market to trade in.
params.minPayout: Minimum collateral the user expects to receive (slippage protection).
params.recipient: Address to receive the payout (use msg.sender to receive directly).
params.shareDelta: The number of shares to sell (in UD60x18 fixed-point).

returns.netPayout: The actual payout sent to the recipient.

PAUSER_ROLE().notice: Role for addresses allowed to pause the router in emergencies.

buyWithPermit(uint256,uint8,uint256,uint.notice: Buy outcome shares with optional EIP-2612 permit for gasless approval.

getMarket(uint256).notice: Get the market address for a given market ID.

isMarketRegistered(uint256).notice: Check if a market is registered with the router.

markets(uint256).notice: Mapping from market ID to the deployed LMSRMarket contract address.

onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,u.notice: Handle receipt of multiple ERC1155 tokens.

onERC1155Received(address,address,uint25.notice: Handle receipt of a single ERC1155 token.

outcomeToken().notice: Shared outcome token contract for minting/burning shares across markets.

paused().notice: Indicates whether the router is paused, blocking all trades.

registerMarket(uint256,address).notice: Register a market so the router can interact with it.

sellAndTransfer(uint256,uint8,uint256,ui.notice: Sell outcome shares and transfer proceeds to a specified recipient.

setPaused(bool).notice: Pause or unpause the router to block trades in emergencies.
